text: Two things fill the mind with ever new and increasing admiration and awe, the more often and steadily we reflect upon them: the starry heavens above me and the moral law within me.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: Act only according to that maxim whereby you can, at the same time, will that it should become a universal law.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: Thoughts without content are empty, intuitions without concepts are blind.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: Out of the crooked timber of humanity, no straight thing was ever made.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: Dare to know! Have the courage to use your own understanding.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: Happiness is not an ideal of reason but of imagination.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: The greatest human unhappiness is found in the attempt to avoid unhappiness.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: Morality is not the doctrine of how we may make ourselves happy, but how we may make ourselves worthy of happiness.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: We are not rich by what we possess but by what we can do without.
author: Immanuel Kant
